column9: I had been diagnosed multiple times with manic depression, anxiety, psychosis etc etc, and yet none of the medications seemed to help me overall with my mood and motivation. Then recently after being diagnosed with fibromyalgia, I was referred to a psychologist for ADD testing which can be affiliated with fibromyalgia. I was then diagnosed with ADD and was put on 10 mg of adderall twice daily. It has done absolute wonders for me. Taking it early enough in the morning and once again around noon keeps me from being up too late. My mood is always heightened and I am very motivated and not overwhelmed. The only downfall is that of a rare side effect, which would be once the adderall starts to wear off, I get the sensation of bugs crawling all over my skin. It scared me at first because my first impression was that it could be bed bugs or scabies, but after both were ruled out, I learned it is a rare and unspoken side effect of this drug, which has been controlled by a low dosage of atarax, which is an antihistamine primarily. and the nice thing about it is that it helps me sleep at night! Anyone else seem to have that bizarre sensation once it gets later in the day and the adderall is wearing off?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Adderall for about 8yrs now and there's good news and bad news. Good news is that it works wonderfully in managing the symptoms. The bad news is that you have to watch how your appetite is affecting your eating habits, usually you won't be hungry until the medicine wears off and you might find yourself malnourished if you're not careful. Also note that you can develop permanent 'tics' or compulsive repetitive behaviors. I have developed a tic of chewing on the side of my tongue. I am now pregnant and cannot take the medication for obvious reasons and yet I still chew on my tongue, but that being said, it isn't severe enough to prevent me from retaking it after my pregnancy because the ADHD is definitely worse than the side-effects of the Adderall. However, every person is different so maybe for other people these 'tics' and appetite changes might not seem so minor. Overall though I have found it very useful and it has made a huge and mostly positive difference in my life, so if you're thinking about trying it to treat your ADHD then I'd say go right ahead.

column2: Stormy48, 45-54 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from depression for most of my adult life but the last two years I was lucky to get up dut to family drama and I had, had enough of hurting. I had no idea that I could be helped so much by a medication. I do understand it is considered an "upper" for those not afflicted with ADHD. I had seen the shows of abuse by parents with this medication. This medication, although, not used for ADHD, for me, allowed me to feel like I wanted to get up and live my life. I have only been on it for less than 6 months but I feel it saved my life by giving me the kick in the butt someone else might get from coffee. Nothing worked for me, complete loss of energy until I started the Adderall Oral. It is mentioned as a treatment for severe depression and I refuse to feel bad for using a medication that made me want to live again. It's not magic, I still have to think positive, not focus on the negative but I'm so thankful this medication serves more than one ailment.

column2: DarkLitLover, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has changed my life completely for the better! I used to be so unorganized, with my manic thinking and racing thoughts and insomnia, as well as being so extremely uncomfortable in any and all social situations. Now I am able to function in daily life and have a daily routine I stick too as well; by feeling comfortable in my own skin and before having no self confidence, now I see myself as attractive and young and intelligent and full of potential. When put on this medication by my doctor - after being on every anti-depressant, anti-psychotic, mood stabilizers and benzodiazapines, etc; since the age of 4 and am now 29 - I now feel that I have finally found the one psychiatric drug that has actually helped me in my life. Not just with my Adult Add, but also with my Generalized Social Anxiety Disorder and Bi-Polar I Disorder and lack of concentration, focus and energy to complete tasks. This drug is a life saver...that is no joke!!! Constant catatonic depression for over a year and being pulled out of it and having your lust for life back, is a gift from the Gods!

column2: NewADHDdiagnosed, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began a new job that I was fully capable of doing, but was tired of stuggling and having no accomplishment.  I would bounce from task to task, and realized that this was the first job that I had to sit and focus.  Having started this med, I can focus, finish what I start without feeling like I have to move or do something else.  In meetings I can remember what was said, because I actually pay attention, I'm not checking my phone or drawing.  Even my coworkers have noticed that I am much more "quiet" (they don't know my condition).  The best part...my head is quiet.  When I first started this med, I felt slow and didn't understand how the rest of the world functioned thinking this slow...to me they were the one with the problem.  Not my fault they couldn't keep up :)  My relationships have gotten better, I actually listen and let them finish speaking.  I'm still busy but I actually get stuff done, and that is the best part.  It's not pieces at a time are completed, the whole thing is completed.  Also, I still get hungy, just full on less food.  But I do drink TONS of water everyday due to the cotton mouth side effect.  Minor annoyance compared to the greatness that is taking place.  I highly recommend this med to anyone that has ADD/ADHD.  You don't lose who you are, just a better more pulled together you shines through.

column9: For over a.decade I was incorrectly diagnosed as having a serious anxiety disorder. During this time, I was treated with xanax(alprazolam) tablets which, as directed, I took 3x a.day. Over these years I was at a dose of up to 6 mg per day. I tried one time foolishly to just stop taking it and was put in the hospital the following day, unaware that I was going through serious and potentially life-threatening issues. Then, lure and behold, in 2009, the dr who I continue to see suggested that I actually seemed to be suffering from adult add. He immediately placed me on adderall. It has been a life changing med and is the sole reason that I.am now free from the addictive grip of xanax. Well, I am now almost totally off of benzos and currently working down from only a 5 mg diazepam...1/2-1 twice daily. Its so nice to be medicated appropriately and arty the same time, I am no longer a slave to anypill. :)))

column2: Kristy, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Adderall since I was in 3rd grade for treatment for my ADHD. I am now a junior in high school and still take it daily for school. When I started taking Adderall it was the 5mg IR before school every day. A very low dosage for an 8 year old but it did help. Since then I changed to 10 mg ER somewhere in later middle school when I was either 13 or 14. Just this year I increased to 20 mg ER before school with 10 mg IR after school in order to help focus on homework. The adderall has been invaluable for me in helping me focus both during school and out, as well as lowering my impulsivity since it gives me that second reaction time before I say something or do something I shouldnt. The only side effect Ive ever noticed is that I do have a decrease of appetite when on the pill and once it wears off Im ravenously hungry. However, once on the medication for 5 days or so that symptom has gone away and I end up hungry again. Overall I would recommend it to anyone with ADD or ADHD.

column9: Hypersomnia. Put on Adderall. Yes, it keeps me awake but the side affects, to me, are not worth it.  I had severe loose bowel movements, slight headaches, shakiness, VERY IRRITABLE AND ADJITATED at every little thing.  Became cold to the world and everyone in it.  Sore throat, and severe rash on my chest that still hasn't gone away after almost 2 weeks off the adderall.  I was very sensitive to anything that seemed loud....things that I normally wouldn't think was loud.  Fighting with my own mind and my family constantly.  Tightness in my thumbs, yeah WEIRD.  Sore tongue and the list goes on. Also, even though I was awake, I had absolutly NO MOTIVATION AND WOULDN'T EVEN COMPLETE A SIMPLE CHORE.  My mood has gotten better since off of this and I would never recommend it to anyone.  But I know each medication is different for everybody. Hey, if I didn't have the HORRIBLE side affects I would still take it because it did keep me from excessive sleep.  Now went to a neuropsychiatrist and he put me on Nuvigil, which I have heard GOOD AND UGLY news about, but can't even try it because my insurance won't cover it.  Now, back to the doc tomorrow to get my script for ritalin and am totally scared because the rates on that med. don't seem any better than the adderall. But, you never know it may work for me.  I can only pray. Just wanted to share my story in case any of you have had these side affects I would immediatly stop.

column2: adderal oral, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
BreezieBoo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: To begin, I've never had an issue with addiction or drug abuse. I'm a college senior with a GPA of 3.6. I LOVE my classes and professors, but I can't pay attention as well as I wished. I found myself drinking insane amounts of coffee just to try and stay focused. I couldn't get through more than 4 pages in a book without having to reread it again. The worst part was, I had absolutely no motivation to do any schoolwork away from school (which used to not be a problem at all.) So, a few weeks ago, a classmate told me she was prescribed Adderall for the last 14 years, but stopped taking it, and selling it to make a quick buck. I had already researched ADD and ADHD and self diagnosed myself. I cut a 20mg pill in half, and didn't feel any difference at all. I waited a day or 2 and tried a full 20mg dose. 30 minutes later or so, I then found myself reading normally again, I was motivated to do things I had put off for weeks, I didn't get bored doing normal everyday things, and I didn't feel like I was moving at a million miles a minute (like I read people felt earlier.) I don't know when or if it even stopped working. I took it around 7pm and went to bed, no problem, at midnight (my typical bedtime) without any issues. I know that I don't HAVE to take it every day at all, but my days off when I want to just sleep and be lazy, I take  just ONE 20mg pill around noon after I have been up for a few hours, and I am far more productive than I have ever been in years. I'm not sure how to go about talking to a doctor about my self-diagnosis, or if there are any other similar medicines that could possibly be prescribed without the overly judged and criticized name Adderall attached to it. Not sure if that helps anyone, but I do see a positive change definitely. I wouldn't use it habitually or for an extended amount of time.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This helped me increase my focus and concentration tremendously... As a result, my grades suffered, self-esteem suffered,  and I wanted to give up. I was prescribed adderall xr my sophomore year in College and I literally noticed a dramatic difference immediately. My grades went from a 2.4 and have remained at a 3.6. I do not recommend for long term use.

column9: My daughter started taking this when she turned 4. She had been on Clonidine but it wasn't helping. It made her very tired so the point of her sitting, staring, nearly drooling on herself. When she started Adderoll it took a week to see real results, but it worked pretty well. She did have some issues with losing weight at first, but over time she gained back to the "normal" range. After almost a year of being on it, it became less effective. She started having violent outbursts, hurting herself and us, screaming, unable to pay attention, and very sad / crying often. I think for a while we had a good run, but when it was over it was OVER. It was like night and day how dramatically she changed when it stopped working. Also it is exteremly hard to find in the 5mg dose she was on. Had to drive to another town to get it. We're starting Ritalin now, hope it works better and for longer.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I knew growing up that i had a problem with focusing & motivation for anything. i caused trouble in school to make the days more exciting or i would count repeatedly in my head & obsess on objects, instead of paying attention. (i also suffer from diagnosed OCD)after high school, i found myself breaking up my family & the life we had going for us, just so i could live my life on the edge with alcohol, pills, & sex. all because i was bored with life & i needed the adrenaline rush to stimulate my mind & body. i was officially diagnosed with ADD without hyperactivity at the age of 23 & started off with Ritalin, which didn't even touch my ADD. i'm finally taking what i wanted all along.. Adderall. i now take 30mg twice a day & it has made all the difference in the world. i can finally focus on tasks at hand, i have the motivation & energy to get things done, and people & things don't irritate me as badly as they did before. side effects? it does give you an addictive "high" that's supposedly comparible to cocaine, so i do see the potential for abuse. it causes insomnia for me if taken too late in the day or if i double my dosage, but i can take my next dose that morning & run like i had a full-night's sleep. i was 143lbs when i started taking Adderall (which is the biggest i have EVER been in my life, due to eating for comfort after the death of my sister) but i am now 126lbs after 3-4 months of being on Adderall. i literally have no appetite anymore.. unhealthy & i know this BUT i honestly love seeing my lbs drop. also makes my heart race at times & can be somewhat alarming, especially since my heart rate is on the high side anyways. the major issue i have had (that i haven't seen from other users) is my OCD is worse than ever now. maybe i'm focusing TOO much & that triggers my OCD? other than that, i think the benefits outweigh the side effects. thank you Adderall. sorry for the long story, but i hope my experience helps & someone else can relate :)

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with ADHD at age 28.  I have a history of procrastination, lack of motivation, organized chaos and extreme fatigue/tiredness accompanied by worrying and anxiety.  I was treated for anxiety to start, pristiq.  Once, under control, My doctor started with a low dose of adderrall increased by 5 mg a day until I reached the point where I felt focused, locked in on my work and time seemed to fly by.  I reached 20 mg and maintained for 30 days.  The results where amazing.  I can't believe I went my whole childhood without this diagnoses.  Anyways, upon my evaluation my doctor "upgraded" me to vyvanse stating that it has a cleaner smoother release and I should benefit more.  The first day I felt like I was on cocaine.  I had lock jaw, grinding my teeth and felt like i was high which kept coming and going.  I gave it 2 weeks and had to quit.  My doctor switched me back to extended release adderrall and I'm symptom free.  My ADHD is under control and I'm functioning much better at work and home.  Eating was one of my coping mechanisms before so the decreased appetite was a welcome.  To combat, I keep lots of fruit, yogurt, veggies and nuts on hand.  My general physician introduced me to a book called "Driven to Distraction" which helped me understand my condition, the different variations, as well as ways to combat.  For me, exercise and to do lists are my keys to success.  Recently, I tried stopping pristiq to see if my anxiety was just a result of the ADHD but found I have a combination condition.  I wouldn't have understood this without reading the book so I highly recommend in addition to adderrall xr.

column9: Here is the issue. ADHD Im diagnosed with by some phychiatrist. Other phychiatrist i have been evaluated by say i don't have it. They all have MD after there names so who is correct and who's incorrect??...I've been off and on adderall for 8 years. Im 28 years old. Yes it helps me concentrate. Yes, it helps motivate me. Yes, it even makes me feel better about myself...however adderall is extremly addictive, so thats the biggest issue with it. This is a med that is in high demand among society and can kill if it falls into the wrong persons hands. Drug users feel great euphoria and energy when they use it, simply put; thats why they use it. Prescription drug abuse is sky rocketing like never before. So parents keep that in mind.---SO-- The fact remains adderall helps a ton with certain people. If you plan to take it here are a few tips (not that im a dr.) 1)If you have a prior substance abuse problem, FORGET adderall 2)Take it exactly how directed by MD. 3)Keep it in a place thats secure, kids know ALL about adderall. 4)Keep an eye on your pulse, BP, and heart rate. The worst side effect i've expericed is becoming anxious on it. I am just trying to give a down to earth review, and i hope it helps some of you.

column2: rngr9782, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I get mixed feelings when it comes to Adderall. I'm a 25 y/o male that was diagnosed with ADHD 3 years ago. I took adderall (30mg, 2x day) for the first 2 years and it worked well for the most part; there were two problems though. For one, if you forget to take your second dose when you're supposed to, you're going to notice...at least I did. Secondly, god-forbid I took my morning dose on an empty stomach; I'd feel really jittery and my mind would race at 100mph. Overall though, it did it's job. I ended up switching doctors at the VA (I'm a vet) and my new doc mentioned dexedrine. I was reluctant to try them, but he put on me on 2x10mg spansules in the morning and 2x10mg tabs in the afternoon. Here I am a year later a lot happier with the results. The onset is smoother, it's easier to eat on it and there are no ups-and-downs. I recommend looking into dexedrine for anyone who runs into these problems with adderall...Also, dexedrine is a lot cheaper than adderall. Generic 10mg IR tabs cost about $.27 each, while the 10mg spansules are 2.16each.

It also helped my depression,helps me sleep better at night (due to me wearing my self out & not napping during the day) the only negative I can think of is,I seem to have developed a tolerance and for some reason my Dr. won't increase my dosage,even though I've been on the same dose for all this time.He has even mentioned taking me off of it for some reason,to which I replied I'd rather stop the pain meds!! Adderall is the BEST thing that ever happened to me in a Dr.s office!

AMYT87, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son who is 8 1/2 has struggled with reading with no improvement despite various tpes of extra help and instruction. He was very implulsive with his behavior always "acting before he thinks", grades at school were very inconsistant. He was failing to "grow out" of certain behaviors. Since starting Adderall ER 20 mg a month ago the change in him is amazing. He is now able to read on grade level, make good choices and is more socially confident. This drug was our missing link for him, we were doing everything possible for him and it all came together once we added the medicine. He is no longer receiving supportive reading services at school. He completes his homework in a timely manner with little assitance, last year it took an hour plus to do 20 mins of HW. It truely has changed our son's life and improved our family. Get your child tested for learning disabilities and ADHD/ADD if you have any concerns. My son didn't fit the mold of what ADHD/ADD looks like but upon testing he presented with Behavorial and Cognitive impulsivity, with a reading disability. Just starting 3rd it was critical to figure out the best way to help him reach his full potential and be happy.We do now give him 7mg of melatonin to help him fall asleep 15 mins prior to bed. He was 20 lbs over weight from implusive eating and so far has lost 6 lbs. So that was an unexpected plus for him. Overall we are very happy with Adderall and the improvment in our son.He takes it at 8 AM and it lasts until between 6-7PM, it wear off gradually.

column2: DrugsAreBadForYou, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This review is for this specific pill, the "dp" adderall.Pros: I will update this post once I find one.Cons:1. The orig formula was changed. These new pills have zero effect.2. The price: over $400/month (120x20mg). Funny facts: Barr, who makes these, also makes generics and sells the same amount for $150... and the generics work (for a while).3. Strange/disturbing fact: an insurance like Aetna does not cover Adderall (brand or gen.) if you're over 18...To parents: do not give this stuff to your kids! Adderall is a mix of amphetamine and dextro-amphetamine, aka street name "Speed"! It's extremely addictive and loses its effectiveness over time. It's a quick fix that will eventually ruin their lives, turning them into drug addicts.  There are many reasons why some kids don't pay attention in class, none of which can be fixed with drugs: 1- they're kids, not robots! 2- Classes are too large and out of control 3- Their teacher is boring 4-The level is either too low (not challenging enough) or too high. 5-they spend too much time on the internet, their cell phones, their ps3, and TV, all of which have been shown to reduce attention span. etc...

column2: dtathomas, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started Adderall-XR after my doctor ruled that I was ADHD, which I was very reluctant to believe. I had a history of suicide attempts, depression, anxiety, violence, etc., which was attributed to a specific event  - being raped by our parish priest as a teenager at 13. The drug Adderall, made it possible for me to be focused, on task, centered and a lot more accessible to psychological treatment which lasted almost 9 years. I am a much better person for doing the treatment, I continue to take Adderall. It is the only "psychological" drug that I now take and was misdiagnosed for over 30 years. Work with your doctor to tweak this drug, to the just right amount - you'll be glad you did. I am just one of the many that lived through a horrid, tumultuous life in regards to the rape, upbringing, violence, etc., and just trying to find the real me. A compassionate, loving, understanding and forgiving me buried deep under the ugly layers  of hell. I wrote a letter to my doctor and expressed the aforementioned and that he could read it to any patient that he desired - if he felt it would "connect" with that patient. My final words would be do not be afraid to ask questions, investigate, get second opinions and never have blind allegiance to one doctor. We all make mistakes and are not perfect for we are truly, only human - it is our nature. Anyone desiring to discuss what any medications have done for me were always welcome but you cannot base your results on someone else. You can only use it as a loose guideline for your own personal situation and physical makeup. That is where your trusted physician comes in and although they may be right on the money regarding one drug that works for you beware - they do not always remember all the drugs you are taking so that is where the patient must be vigilant, especially when being referred from specialist to another doctor or specialist. I bring an up-to-date prescription printout to any new doctors as a new patient. Thank You -

column2: Mike Church, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I has made me more calm and I can now function almost normally. I was sexually abused also in my teens and have serious control issues that I cannot see to get rid of. actually makes it go away for the most part.  I am a lot less aggressive with others.

column2: FlyByTurkey, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Where to begin... I decided to start seeing a therapist when my anger and irritability issues were having an impact on everyone around me including my children and my girlfriend and her daughter. I have always had these issues but I can also be a very fun person too. After a few visits with the therapist and asking her for help with the anger among other issues including concentration. She gave me a test for ADD and failed miserably. Went to the Dr. and he prescribed 20mg Prozac a day and 10mg of Adderall twice daily. WOW! Slap in the face and one happy son of a gun. For a week it was weird because of adjusting to the meds. Not much sleep and felt foggy and strange but that went away. After a couple of weeks I upped the Prozac to 40mg a day. Worked a lot better for me (28 year old male 215lbs).  I tried not taking the Adderall on the weekends but I just got distant and irritable. I thought it was the Prozac so I tried stopping it and just taking Adderall. Nope, that didn't work. I got easily car sick and real irritable. So just went back on both at the same time until I could talk to my Dr. about switching or something. I decided to try upping the Adderall by splitting on in half and taking 15mg in the morning and 5mg later in the day. I felt a lot better on a higher dose. I decided to save up a few extras and try to take 20mg in the morning and 20mg later in the day. WOW! That is a lot different feeling. I can really concentrate now and I actually get up and do things and finish them instead of just wanting to but can't seem to just do it. My girlfriend (now my wife) is loving it. I taught her daughter how to ride a bike, cleaned up the garage and organized it (which has been a dump for a long time) and I cleaned up my office (boss has been on my butt for a while). Best part is, I love that I am a person now. Cure for depression and anxiety: antidepressant + Adderall. Antidepressant to numb the pain and Adderall to get your butt up and enjoy life!

column2: Eiheiken, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has helped my ADD tremendously especially in the work place. Some side effects though more so from coming off of it when I take drug holidays they are usually spent sleeping on the couch. When I take it though I do very well and usually by the end of the day sleeping is not a problem. However it used to be a problem when I took the XR version. Now I take the plain old fashion immediate release tablets 30mg at a time. Once in the morning and then in the afternoon or I break my afternoon in half to make an additional 15mg available to take closer to 4:00pm but no later that a way I can stretch it out if its a longer day. At this dosage/prescription I don't suffer from insomnia as the drug tends to wear off my quickly at the end of the day and then I can sleep. Some side effects like feeling speedy and shaky can happen but are usually mild if not somewhat pleasant anyhow. I've been taking this dosage for years and I still say there is an advantage to having ADD. One is being able to take Adderall as I can usually run circles around my co-workers. When I'm on my medicine its like my personality lights up a little more and I stay focused and on task with little negative side effects. After so many years my body is addicted to it though hence the major withdrawal I go through on the couch on drug holidays. But if you don't mind being lazy and sleepy during those time I think it is well worth it all. Adderall is 4 amphetamine salts in one tablet so its like the inventors of this drug just said to themselves "well one of these stimulants has to hit the right spot" and then they marketed it with the clever name ADD ERALL. So for what ever reason it does work well for ADD. The only other drug I haven't tried for ADD is Desoxyn (methamphetamine) I guess I have been afraid to even ask for it just by the stigma that goes along with the name. So my experience with these drugs is well worth mentioning if you want an honest and thorough review.

column2: Nick, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am on Adderal XR. I began with 20 mgs and that worked for about three months. During this time I did not suffer from any side effects.But,I began to feel "out of it" again and found myself struggling to focus and being overwhelmed with all my tasks. I also (again) had problems with impulsiveness and not being able to "think clearly". I asked my doctor for an increase and he then prescribed 30 mgs a day. It did help. I also discovered that the generic did not work for me. I am experiencing dry mouth as a side effect. With the medication I've estimated that it has decreased my impulsivity by 85%. I believe it has taken a years time and a bit more for me to see the maximum effect of the medication. It's as though my brain needed that much time to get "soaked" by the Adderall XR. I am now in the place where I am now starting to deal with developing good habits to overcome my great disorganization. I am trying to strengthen my ability to think linearly.  When I first started the medication (at 20 mgs and again at 30 mgs) I found disorganization unsettling and I became neater for a time.  I then again became sloppy and I was bothered by the fact that the sloppiness didn't seem to bother me. Over all I'm happy with the medication.

column9: Overall, Adderall (30mg/daily) has worked well for me. My academics have greatly improved and my ability to start, continue, and complete a task are a complete change. However, like many others have said, you quickly grow a tolerance to it. I have noticed an improvement with this by taking 1-2 days off a week. Those days are of course a little rough but the only thing that has helped me from the tolerance issues. I also have sleep apnea and if I'm having a rough day it sometimes makes me feel even more fatigued. The "crashing" after the medication begins to fade is sometimes worse then simply not taking it at all. So far the only medication I've tried for ADHD but overall a good medication thus far, not sure If I'd say the same if used for sleep related disorders.

column2: wowthisstuffworks!, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm a college student majoring in electrical engineering and I was diagnosed with adhd when I was 12 years old: i was one angry and hyper kid! Anyways I was perscribed to Strattera as I entered middle school beginning with 20 mg. After seven years this medication was working miracles with a few ups and downs here and there... well that's the good part. The bad news is the positive effects literally "shut off" in a matter of two weeks this past winter. I was back to that child who could barely read a couple of pages in a book, let alone prepare for exams and papers as a college freshman. It was terrible: I lost great relationships with friends and family, suffered from depression and constant unpredictable mood swings, and the list goes on and on. Even with an increase in 80 mg the pills were useless unless two or more were consumed a day. I talked to my doctor about the problem and he said drastic neurochemical changes may have built a tolerance against the strattera, which is farely common with that particular drug. To compensate, he perscribed 20 mg of Adderall to take with 100 mg of Strattera a day, and let me tell you, the waters have settled and the sun shines again! Complete clarity and focus, anxiety almost nonexistent, and I feel back to my normal self. Only thing is that my appetite has diminished quite a bit and I have the libido of a neutered camel, but those don't outweigh the fact that life is GREAT again. I could see where an addiction could transpire because it's pretty much altered cocaine that's approved by the fda, but really it all comes down to you: "can I survive w/o downing 16 pills today?"

column9: I started taking Adderall 4 years ago.  I noticed a difference immediately.  I no longer had panic attacks, I was able to focus more easily.  Less fender benders due to not paying attention.  I will say that after years of being on this medication I have developed a bit of a tolerance for the dosage I am currently on. The dosage should be adjusted according to patient need.  Afterall, each individual patient is unique and different.  I am a bright, intelligent 38 year old woman who has ADD, NOT ADHD.  There is a difference.  This is the only medication I have found that works for me.  I can concentrate.  I am not having panic attacks anymore.  I do experience upset stomach at times. I reduced my dose to 5MG from 10MG because of this so I don't feel this is at all addictive for me since I don't want more than enough to treat my symptoms where life is normal again. I now can listen to people where before they'd talk and I'd go yep, yep, yep and never understand a word winging it hoping I did not miss something important. column1: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
column2: 65-74 Male  (Patient)
Sliske, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was about 12 years old or so when I started taking Adderall. People said they noticed an immediate difference- my grades improved, I started paying attention, I was more obedient. Then, by the time I turned 13, I began to have chronic stomach pains, which continue to plague me to this day. At the time, I was battling ADD, depression, anxiety... you name it. The stomach issues were just another thing to add to the list. By age 15, I had an endoscopy, and it discovered I had a condition known as Eosinaphililic Esophagitis (I think that's how it's spelled) as well as an ulcer. I continued taking medicine to treat everything, until I had the idea to just stop taking my medicine altogether. That was at age 16. For more than a year and a half, I experienced NO pain whatsoever from my stomach, my depression faded, and I was still able to focus as well as I was able to on the drug. I haven't taken it since, as I haven't felt a need to, though I still take the stomach medicine as needed. Bottom line- Adderall interfered with many of the other drugs I was taking to treat other things, and kept me in a state of perpetual pain. But I was always alert and focused, so technically, the pill did its job. I don't see how everyone says this pill is addictive, I find it far from that. During the time I was taking the medicine, I continued to gain weight until I was nearly 300 pounds. Now, it's been almost 2 years since I've taken them, and the weight melted off naturally, I'm down to 175- lighter than I've been in years. I feel better, and I still can focus as well as I could on the drug, despite not taking it. All in all, I wouldn't really recommend taking this drug if you take other medicines in conjunction, but it surely gets the job done if you don't mind the agony...

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Whether or not you have "ADD" adderall will help you concentrate, get things done, be more efficient etc.. Im a Senior in college.. 95% of people use it to study. If your kid says this isn't true.. they are lying.. or a freshman.. or from Idaho. I was tested and given 20mg pills... at first it was amazing. Not only could I sit down studying for my exams for 10 hours straight (literally) but it felt fun to study. Class was all of a sudden so interesting. Loooong story short, after a few months of using it off an on (about 3 pills a week) the effects changed. Yes, I could concentrate better when I was alone studying/doing school work. However, when taking adderall I felt like some kind of zombie. Like.. I couldn't smile couldn't laugh, didn't want to talk to anyone..(Im usually very extroverted). The day after taking adderall I sleep until about 2 or 3 pm. Ew! Typically I wake up at 7am and cannot sleep past 9 am! Once you start using the drug it is hard to get off it. Example: I am not physically dependent but when HUGE exams come along I mentally feel like I NEEED adderall. And yes, I use it. (Stopping after graduation in a week). The mind is a powerful thing. Once you get off the drug, once simple tasks may seem laborious. Final point:: I wish I never tried it. Also... I agree with a comment right below.. it is so sad that children are given this drug. Crazy. Try changing their diet.. brain teasers.. holistic options! Im a psychology major and we were just learning how on a basic-level naturalists perspective.. kids are not supposed to have great concentration because its a time to explore as much as they can as their highly plastic brains develop. Soak it all in! Helloooo people, what elementary kid do you see sitting still & silent focusing on their workbook 24/7? Little adderrall robot antisocial children? Oh yea.. in all of my neuroscience courses we learned the chemical properties of the drug. Very similar to speed.. and cocaine.

column2: Lina, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just started taking this about 1 month ago. It really works for me. Before, I had trouble concentrating and finishing tasks. Even minor things on my 'to-do' list (like mailing letters, making phone calls,etc.) would feel like a huge weight on my shoulders. Adderall helped with all of those issues. I take between 5mg - 10mg per day. Anymore than that would make me tense (I'm surprized that most reviewers here seem to take much more. Sometimes reviewers even call 20-30mg a 'small dose'--not for me!). I split it up--half around 9am, the other around 1pm. It's true it'll keep you awake at night if you take it too late. Other pros: I used to get very fatigued (perhaps even chronic), sleeping 9-10 hours at night, then feeling exhausted around 2pm. Adderall keeps me energized and wakeful (including w/sex life!). Other pro: besides ADD, I may have mild depression. Adderall has improved my mood. Cons: At the end of the day when the meds ware off I feel a bit socially disconnected, somewhat agitated, w/mild headaches. These are minor given the benefits.

column2: capless, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have depression with anxiety and have been on medication for 20 years.  My symptoms have changed over the years; more anxiety, less depression when I was younger now its more depression with less anxiety.  My thinking became disorganized.  I was forgetful and easily distracted.  When my doc suggested this med I was very concerned it would increase my anxiety level but agreed to a trial.  That was over 5 years ago.  My energy level is increased, I'm much less forgetful, my mood is improved and there was no increase in anxiety.  When I've stopped the med my mood plunges, my energy level drops, I become irritable and I'm miserable to live with.  I take 40 mg every morning and sleep well.  I did have a trial of the XL version but found it ineffective.

column9: I have beem on adderall for about a year now. I started with 39mg 2x a day. It was a ;miracle; drug. I had motivation, great concentration and I was like superman. I could work out for hours non stop for hours and stayed up for up to 5 days in a row just cleaning and remodeling the house. With tine the medication looses its potency because u develop a tolerance. First was 60mg a day than 90mg, than 129mg and now im on 159mg-30mg 5x daily). I used to be able to take hakf of a 30mg tab when I started and be superman. Than taking it oraly did not work for me unless I tripled my dose. So I started crushing and snorting the drug. Right now my tolerance is so high I can snort 150mg very easy. Whats next 180mg? Probably My One time I lost my pills and I was literally narcoleptic, sleeping about 16hrs a day going through crazy withdtawals and not knowing what to do with myself. I felt I was literally going to loose my mind. I was so sick(head sick) that I could barely make my doctors appointment to get a new script. If I didnt have my xanex for the withdrawal I probably would have killed myself.This drug is very effective but also super sddictive. The sad thing is they give this drug to little 3 year old kids whos parents cant be real parents and want a magic solution that comes in pill form. Think about it amphetamine=adderall. Adderall is lagalized speed. How do you give a 3 or 4 year old amphetamines. Their four and supposed to be roudy and have alot of energy and stamina.Their $!!!!!Overall I think its an excelent drug if it is prescribed properly by a doctor. It helps my depression and fatigue problems as well.Motivation, concentration, determination=dependance.

column2: dave75b, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am 35 years old and have been taking Adderal for 6 months now. Although it has helped me focus on tasks and allowed me to complete projects without a problem it has also made me almost obsessed with whatever the task is that I am doing. For example, I wanted to clean my pantry counter, a quick spray with some cleaner and wipe it down, no big deal right. About three hours later I realized I had cleaned the counter, the stove inside and out, the dishwasher, sink, floor, and organized the cabinets. It felt as if I had to keep cleaning until everything was perfect and it just feels strange. Some may say that is a good thing but If I had video taped it I probably would of looked like a crazy person while doing it. Also, I lost a good amount of weight since taking Adderal and now I feel I am to thin. I am 5'7" and my weight was 155lbs before the Adderal, I looked healthy. My weight went down to 132lbs and I looked sick but did manage over the last few months to get up to 145lbs. I take 50mg a day, 30mg in the am and 20mg around noon. I have tried lowering the dose but it did absolutly nothing for me and without the second dose I end up crashing and want to nap by 2pm so the seond dose is basically to keep me going till bedtime. I do have trouble sleeping and even more trouble waking up but once I take my morning pill a half hour later I am good to go. Well that is my experience with Adderal so far, oh yeah, one more thing to add. I don't know if this happens to anyone else but I notice my hands and feet feel real cold at times and even though I will be sweating I am always cold. Well take care everyone, hope everyone has a great day. :)

column2: KB, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take 10mg twice daily, once in the morning ~8-9am, and again between 12 and 1pm. Have been doing so for about 6-7 yrs. Only other ADD med I've tried was Ritalin for a short time, which didn't seem as helpful.  Pros: Improved focus, concentration, motivation for boring/difficult tasks.  Cons: Insomnia, which is why I could not tolerate the extended release, and must make sure not to take the 2nd dose later than about 1pm. A small dose of Trazadone (25-50mg) has helped with the insomnia. Does take away appetite temporarily, but I make sure to force myself to eat adequately, b/c if not I am left feeling ravenous at the end of the day when it is wearing off, and have a headache and feel more moody than usual.  Need to take a 'drug holiday' at least 1 day each week, or else the med starts to feel less effective.  I do tend to 'hyperfocus' on things that I shouldn't necessarily be focusing on at that given time, but I'm not sure if this is just a symptom of ADD itself or a symptom exacerbated by the medication. Do see this as being addictive in terms of feeling the need to stay on it (though why would I NOT feel like I should stay on it, as it is helpful for my ADD).  However have not ever felt the need for a higher dose.  May increase levels of anxiety, if this is an underlying problem you already have. Has been helpful for ADD symptoms, but I've also realized it is not a magic cure, and cannot stress enough the importance of being proactive in terms of learning your individual weaknesses and trying different ways to help overcome them.  WebMD has been helpful, along with www.ADDitude.com and www.ThriveWithADD.com.  Would love to meet with a psychotherapist that specializes in ADD, but haven't been able to find such a thing.  A life coach specializing in ADD would also be great, but unfortunately is not covered by insurance and seems to be quite costly.  Overall has been helpful for me, but do believe that everyone is affected differently.  Good luck!

column2: hopeful, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 40 yrs. old and have been on Adderall 20 mg 2x a day for 2 yrs. now. I am also on a BP med and Effexor XR.  All taken together have proven just how productive I am at completing tasks at work.  Although I have found that there is an interaction when I take the Adderall and Effexor together, so now I allow at least 2 hrs. after taking Adderall before taking Effexor. The great thing is I have always been able to sleep really well.  After trial and error with other ADD meds found this to be most effective.  However at 3:30-4:00 pm in the afternoon it wears off.  I don't reallty know what to do with myself, feel like I need a small dose to keep up with things I have to attend after work, errands, and in social settings. I am lucky to have a doctor who shares a real concern about the side effects in it increasing my heart rate.  She has already referred me to a cardiologist only to find that Adderall in combination with the other 2 meds raises my heart rate some.  Enough for her to put me on BP med taken everyday.  Sure there are some mild side effects of being tired but but there could be dangers in increasing the size of my heart down the road.  So the risks outweigh the mild side effects.  Just now need to bring to Dr's attention that I might need something for focus early evening.  Anybody out there who needs to take a small dosage of Adderall? Any suggestions?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Adderall has been a lifesaver.  Once again, I was faced with the possibility of losing my job for trivial errors: forgetting to stamp this, forgetting to notate that, etc. until I finally spoke with my doctor who actually took the time with me to go over my symptoms (forgetfulness, constant interrupting, fidgeting, inability to concentrate) and came to the conclusion that I was, and had been for years, dealing with ADHD.  Within a few weeks time of taking it, I've noticed an improvement not only in my ability to concentrate and get all of my tasks finished at work, but I'm able to get more done around the house, I don't constantly feel as though I need to get up from my desk every 10 minutes and walk around, and mornings have become SO much easier.  I cannot thank my doctor enough for actually taking the time to ask me questions and figure out a prescription that works best for both myself and my lifestyle.

column2: peacedreami, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I took this drug from 2001 through 2010 and unfortunately never realized that this drug was the cause of intense calf pain and horrible circulation in my legs and hands. My feet used to literally turn blue. My legs in general were always bluish. I went to dozens of doctors over the past decade for a diagnosis. I even proactively asked the doctors if adderral could be causing the awful calf pain (which was the result of such poor circulation). The doctors all told me "no". FINALLY, I found an incredible doctor who researched my pain extensively and told me that adderral may indeed be the cause of the freezing cold hands and feet, as well as awful pain in my legs. Adderral is AWFUL to get off of. VERY DIFFICULT. I'm now off adderral and my pain is 90% better and I no longer have blue hands and feet. This drug can work wonders...but it has the potential to cause many health problems.

column2: Lionheart, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has its pros and cons. I've never been able to focus on anything for more than 30 minutes at most, especially with work and school. It took a while to figure out what worked for me, but due to insomnia I use the instant release tablets since they wear off by the end of the day. I take 15 to 30 mg per day and it works wonderfully. I feel like I can actually function like "normal" people. The downside is that this is a stimulant so it will wake you up and makes sleeping difficult. It also causes a loss of appetite, which can be rather difficult to deal with. After taking a dose, it becomes nearly impossible to eat. Even forcing food down with liquids is a chore. It's as if food has no appeal or satisfying taste. Another negative side-effect of the instant release tablets is the comedown. Since this is a stimulant similar to speed/cocaine/meth, it can have an intense comedown. I become very easily agitated (little things will set me off), I get headaches, and I overall just feel sick. This is more intense if you haven't been eating throughout the day and if your taking a higher dose. Being aware of how crappy the comedown is makes it easier to deal with. I now can control my mood very well during my comedown and it now rarely affects me. I am not recommending this since it is an illegal solution (unless you have a medical prescription), but "herbal" use has been extremely helpful with the side-effects. Once my day is over and my comedown is beginning to make me feel sick, a little greenery goes a long way. It removes all the negative moods and headaches, restores my appetite, and helps me fall asleep. I can not believe such a helpful drug is illegal, because I would be (more) underweight and sick without it. It's what works for me and my prescribing psychiatrist is aware of my use, but I'm not here to preach about it.Basically, Adderall side-effects can be ROUGH, but without it I could never manage to work 8 hour days or sit through night class.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
stud4studosu, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have higher than normal blood pressure, so I stopped smoking and reduced my caffeine intake before asking my doctor about it.  I would have been considered a light "on and off" smoker; probably 3-5 per day for a few months, then I'd stop for a few months, and repeat.  Two weeks afterward, I decided to go out a few nights and had a few cigs at the bar.  The next day when I took my Adderall, I had an immediate urge to smoke.  It was to the point that I wanted to smoke up to a whole pack in a day.Being as it's a stimulant, it definitely helped me focus on schoolwork.  I've been on a number of psychiatric meds, most of which killed off my libido and led to sexual dysfunction.  My libido went sky high, but it destroyed my ability to perform.  I'm sure it was caused by the Adderall in addition to smoking because I checked my blood pressure about a month later and it spiked to 165/80.I also have seasonal depression, and during this period the Adderall made me irritable.  Eventually, the depression killed off the effects of Adderall.  I just started an antidepressant, so hopefully this will correct it.Be very careful if you have high blood pressure, smoke, or consume excessive amounts of caffeine.  If you anxiety, depression, or bipolar disorder, as I do, you may have better results with the Adderall in treating ADHD.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
Shyboi30, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm a 30 year old white male who is a recovering addict from meth. I'm diagnosed with ADD w\o Hyperactivity. My life has been a stuggle. I lived with this disorder untreated for most of my life. this is how I found my way to meth addiction before I found out my real problem.  I want everyone to know that this medication is nothing like meth. A lot of people say that it is and a lot of people believe that it is. Let me, being someone who has experienced both. Tell you that it is not at all the same.  To be honest with you I wish that it was. Do not think that in anyway I'm trying to say that meth is a good drug in anyway. What I'm saying is, is that meth for people with ADD is a form of self medication and its addicting to us because we become normal people. I had high hopes that this medication would have some of the positive results that meth offers and none of the negative attributes of that drug.  I'm pretty sure I can tell you why this medication is addictive to people though. I've been on a lot of different medications and have learned well how to evaluate their effect on my life. This medication is the most difficult to figure out dosage and the most inconsistent medication I have ever dealt with. This medication can be addicting for us because we are tired of living our lives with ADD. When you take the medication and get varied and inconsistent results you want positive results so you take more to try to find that place where it helps you and remains effective. Its not a medication that you can just take the dosage when your supposed to and it will do what its supposed to. So far I'm not pleased with adderall. I will probably ask my doctor for something else on my next visit and pray that something else will work better for me. I know that this medication helps some people and I really wish that I was getting those kind of results. It would be nice to be able to speak with other people taking this medication and see what their experience has been like.

column9: I have taken adderall for about 8 years now.  I have some mixed feelings about it.  I would not recomend it because of soo many mood swings, and it is very addictive. It also made me lose my appatite in the mourning and I would have to force me to eat then later on in the afternoon I would be starved cause i hadn't ate much earlier because the pills made me not hungry.  This stuff did calm me down to some extent but I became a whole different person when I was on this and it changed my personality and that was not a good thing.  My grades in school did greatly improve on this stuff.  And it does work immediatly when I take it.  I also noticed though when I took this it made me focus but made me focus on things I shouldn't be focused on.  This makes you feel awake when you first take it then like right after lunch time you feel completly ezhausted and you can't focus on anything, plus i would get headaches every day.  This stuff did temperaily put you in a real good mood like 15 min after you take it then all the sudden you were in a bad mood.  This stuff works great for like a couple years, then after a while you feel addicted to this drug and like it consumes your life.  There are too many ups and downs with this and a different moods every hour.  And without this drug I am not a moodie guy at all.  So I would not reccomend this stuff at all. column2: banana, 13-18 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Be very careful when choosing to take this drug, or any amphetamine. If you look at the pamphlet, I experienced the "rare but serious side effect". I basically had something that mimicked a heart attack on the 1st dose. For months I had chest tightness, weakness on the left side of my body, and felt like I could pass out all the time. It's rare... but it does happen. And it ruined my year. I'm ok now, but I was worried for months that I had damaged my heart at the age of 16. Just... be careful. Try to work with your ADHD without amphetamines. They're basically speed.

column2: gigi, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: A calmness with ability to focus on one thing

CAUTION: THIS MED CAN BE VERY DANGEROUS!!! Being in the medical industry and a user of adderall for nearly a year. Few significant things need to be said. While it did help me focus, I also ended up in the emergency room with a 194/126 BLOOD PRESSURE. Muscle twitches were rampant. Horrific negative moods with sometimes uncontrolled verbal aggression are commonplace (within myself and patients I tend to). Sleeplessness goes without saying especially with XR (extended release). I also experienced confusion and dizziness (also reported by many patients). It causes excessive urination as well which tends to deplete your potassium (which helps maintain normal heart rhythms). Eat a banana. Dehydration is a bad side effect so drink plenty of water as well. You have to ask yourself...is focus and production increase worth the risk?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am an adult and was diagnosed with attention deficit disorder without hyperactivity. This medication has made a huge difference in my ability to initiate and focus on tasks as well as retain information. Positive side effects so far have been weight loss, mild euphoria, and improved energy and mood. Less positive side effects include dry mouth, insomnia (I am up all night if I take this too late in the afternoon), racing pulse, and occasional nausea. It's also definitely a little addictive, more psychologically than physiologically, and on the days I don't take it I feel kind of crappy and inadequate.All in all this medication has dramatically improved my ability to function at home, school and work and I am excited to be starting a new chapter of my life.

column2: Help is out there!!, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have been on the generic adderall for about 4 months now 20mgs 2xday. It has worked wonders for me at work and my home life with the boyfriend. The hardest part is im a 2nd shifter. so i will stay up till like 4am and want to get up at 2 right before work. Making me feel like im rushing everywhere before i take my meds. I take my med at 2:30pm and at 7pm. B4 i got on it i had a hard time remember what my boss told me to do. I kept losing my tools for my job. i would forget to fill out all my paper work. And since i started taking it i'm very focused my rate has gone up. I remember where i leave stuff. I have always love to workout but, now i stay more focused on my diet and exercise. And i have helpped many people around me with health issues and to get closer to God. It has helpped me so much. i wish now that my parents would of not been so against ADHD meds. when i was a kid i had a lot of trouble in school. I got alot of help from the teachers they would read my test to me so i could hear it and see it at the same time. I know now that i would of got better grades and not suffered so much if my parents would of not jugded everything by what they hear on the news about kids beating up kids for retalin on the bus. It has worked wonders and i dont plan on taking it my whole life it just has helpped me get my lifed turned around. I have always loved to make people smile with the dorky little things and sound effects i make just for fun and i know you make awesome sound effects to if you have the same prob:) I have not lost my wonderful personality. I am very greatful for the chance to get my life on track for once and not be lost in lifes smallest things anymore. I have tried concerta but was very expensive. and retalin but it made my stomach ache and i got mood swings. I hope i have helpped someone out there by them reading this. P.S i kick butt in video games now cause i can actually focus on them. God Bless you n i will pray for you. Pray for what meds u need:)

column2: pikachukiller84, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hi, I have never been diagnosed with anything or taken any medications until just recently. I am a 26 year old make and have been feeling very down for almost a year to the point of wishing to die everyday. I have always felt it even as a child, but recently decided to seek help. The doctor prescribed me Celexa 20mg at first, I took it for a couple weeks and really didnt notice anything. He upped it to 40mg/day (Celexa) and after about a month on it I started to notice a change. It happens pretty slow, and it is subtle. But now I am much happier, I can talk to my family now without getting an attitude, and I have an overall feeling of "life is good". The only thing negative I noticed about it was sometimes I would feel zoned out, or staring off into space. So the doctor prescribed me Adderall 10mg twice a day. I have only been taking the adderrall for about 4 days but let me tell you... this drug can work for you or against you. The first day I got it, I didnt take it early enough and was up all night. The second day I took it in the morning, and then in the afternoon. The first time taking it the feeling was intense. One pill makes you not feel much, but after the second one you get euphoria that last's for about an hour or two and you have the feeling of being on coke or something. I was unclear for a couple of days how to use it because I didnt really feel like I could concentrate. So today I reduced it to one just before I took my test and found it to be ok. It isnt what I thought, I know it would work better if I took the second dose, but i didnt want to seem wired today, and I wanted to get a goodnight sleep. As far as mood goes, the Adderall put me in a really good mood, non aggressive, and also very relaxed (even though I felt wired and cracked out). I want to know what I should do, because 1 dose in the morning is ok, but the second one really enhances the situation, clears my head up and allows me to concentrate, but like I said the feeling for a few hour

column2: webmd, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
tiffanyannem1219, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This treatment is the best thing that has ever happened to me....I was diagnosed with ADHD when I was a little kid. At the time my mother refused to put me on medication because she feared I would be put into special ed classes. I hated school, with a passion. I was bored with what I was being taught, and focusing on doing homework was impossible. After dropping out of high school, and moving to a different state, I got my GED and started college. I talked to my doctor about my problems in the past with ADHD and she started me out on Concerta, which didn't do anything at all. She then switched me to Adderall XR 20mg once a day. For me this medicine is an absolute miracle. I can't believe the difference it has made in my ability to focus, not only on school, but living life in general.This drug definitely does not work for everyone. I have read a lot of reviews about children having negative reactions. A close friend of mine's son was taking 30mg a day at the age of 12. He also has MANY other psychological problems as well, and Adderall turned him into a monster. His rage towards everyone around him was unbelievable. When he stopped taking it his behavior improved tremendously. In my opinion I think doctors are giving kids way too high of a dosage. Withdrawals from Adderall is a nightmare. I've taken a few breaks from it for about a month at a time within the past few years. I slept at least 16+ hours a day for a week straight. When I wasn't sleeping I was eating. The mood swings were terrible, and I had NO patience for ANYTHING or ANYONE. But after about a week I was almost back to normal. Adderall sometimes makes me very compulsive.  I will occasionally obsessively pick at my skin, and once I start its really hard to stop. Not many people experience that. Also as a smoker, it makes me smoke A LOT.I also found that Vitamin C pretty much blocks Adderall from absorbing into the body. Once I stopped drinking juices w/ vit. C, the Adderall worked normall

trader, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 34 year old male that was first prescribed this drug over a year ago. I have been on and off antidepressants since about 25 for panic attacks and depression which seems to be to  genetics. It seems I had a low lying depression for years that I never realized but soon became clear when I finally went to a doctor. I never liked meds so I was on and off of them. Nothing had really changed for me in life so i was always self diagnosing and realized(i thought) i have ADD! All the symptoms were there, told my doc who is prescription happy and gave me a script. No tests, no medical screening, just a script for 20mg 3X daily to START OFF. Giving someone that much of a hardcore narcotic who suffers from panic and depression is just beyond me. Sure it made me concentrate, big freakin deal...I always did well academically without even trying. It also made me lose all patience, had zero personality, and just withdrew from life, didn't eat or sleep and depression worsened. The toppper is that within a month I was in the emergency room for what I was certain was a heart attack. So I threw out the pills, but again I decided another shot but lower dosage. Same results pretty much. I know this drug helps countless people but if you take you better damn well make sure that you have ADD for real and not just making excuses for your failings in school, work etc. And please if you read this, and you have depression and get panic attacks don't even think about touching Adderral or any other stimulant drugs. How the FDA could approve something so dangerous and highly addictive and abused is beyond me. They should just go ahead and legalize cocaine while they are at it and tax it. Bet the nation's deficit would be gone in a year!

column9: I just started taking Adderall yesterday morning. I was originally diagnosed with Bipolar disorder, but after changing doctors I am found to have ADD. Didn't get in much trouble other then talking to much, or being a class clown,until after high school.Normal mornings without Meds,I could barely get out of bed,I had been angry and frustrated,with  MAJOR depression, and this is as soon as I get up!I just felt like a failure! Everything I do seems like such a task,appointments,or family gatherings have been like pulling teeth for me.Honestly getting into the Drs is a life saver. Because I couldn't have been that miserable for much longer. I know I just started taking this med.but today when my alarm clock went off,I hopped right out of bed and made breakfast for my daughter before she was even up.I normally would go back to bed once she went to school,and I have been up since.I feel happy,I even felt good last night.I am worried bc my blood pressure gets high when I am stressed out or upset, and I worry about the adderall making that worse. column9: Adderall has been a lifesaver for me.. literally. Before switching medications, I had been on Strattera in high school, which had left me depressed and without any change in my symptoms. When I started college I switched to Adderall and it made a significant different in my academic performance and improved my self worth tremendously. My only side effects were weight loss and insomnia, which eventually diminished after my dosage was correctly adjusted. While I am extremely satisfied with my experience on Adderall, I understand that each drug is different for every person  .. but I still think people should be willing to try several drugs and dosages until they find what works for them.. because effective treatment TRULY makes a difference!

column9: PLEASE READ IF YOU TAKE AN SSRI (CELEXA). STARTED USING ADDERALL XR 30 MG. AFTER 3-4 DAYS I DEVELOPED SERATONIN SYNDROME (SWEATING, STOMACH PAIN, TREMORS, ETC.  I THOUGHT THE TIME RELEASE CAPSULES RELEASED ALL AT ONCE.  NOT TRUE.  THERE IS A VERY HIGH RISK OF COMBINING ADDERALL WITH AN SSRI. OF COURSE, NO ONE WARNED ME. MY DOCTOR SWITCHED ME TO 15 MG TABS TWICE DAILY. ADDERALL HAS ALLOWED TO ORGANIZE AND THINK AGAIN, PERFORMANCE AT WORK IS WAY UP, BUT AFTER THE SECOND DOSE AT NOON I'M STILL READY FOR NAP AT 5PM, WORRIED ABOUT FALLING ASLEEP AT THE WHEEL AGAIN. column9: This drug is amphetamine, the one ingredient in methamphetamine. Warning to all look it up on the internet. Go to the DEA or FDA websites. It is an highly addictive drug. column2: John R., 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have PTSD from service in Vietnam. 100% disabled.  Recently in the last year I noticed radical changes in my behaviors and sypmtoms.  Not being able to focus, concentrate, lack of desire to do tasks or jumping from one to another to another and never getting anything finished.  On top of that my sleep patterns changed in a way different from my PTSD symptoms.  I began to stay up all night for no good reason and sleep most of the day.  Formally, with the PTSD I would not be able to go to sleep at night with racing thoughts about the war or I would go to sleep and wake up in sweating from horrible nightmares. Now it's like I have both going on except I seem to not have the racing thoughts about the war so much, in fact, hardly at all.  I recently started taking 20mg of Adderall XR last week but it does not last long enough and I only feel just a little bit more like doing tasks and finishing them.  It just doesn't feel like the dosage is strong enough.  I find myself drifting off to sleep in the middle of the afternoon.  I have a fulltime Psychologist and MD to monitor my situation.My Internest MD diagnosed me with ADD.

column2: tired kitty, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on generic Adderal,10mg 3x day for three days. I had a sleep study and have a "fragmented sleep pattern" but just shy of having narcolepsy. After sleeping for 17 hrs a day for four years, falling asleep while on the computer, watching tv, dozing off while shopping and doing dishes, it's nice to wake up at 10am not 4pm. I was so depressed *because* I couldn't wake up, not because of my depression which is well treated. My psychiatrist didn't care to listen. I'm still getting the timing right so I can sleep well at night. I do take meds for anxiety, seizures, atypical depression, and tremors with muscular contortions. Thought adderal would really agitate all this but all I do is shake a little bit. I drag a lot between doses and my concentration goes away. I feel really physically hungry when I'm hungry, but every food seems repulsive to me. I force myself to eat. I've had really tight muscles, partly because of occasional contortions, partly from adderal plus scoliosis. I do a lot of stretching and see my chiro. My pulse stays at 84 bps, some very brief palpitations (one or two per day) so NO caffeine. I meditate and do breathing exercises. One very weird thing: Night sweats. Otherwise great. I'm awake all day, can concentrate (no memory due to Topomax), and can do journaling and my art again plus be social. No more haze and I'm enjoying life for the first time in years!

column9: My son is 10yrs old in the 4th grade (held him back in 1st grade due to failing while he was getting diagnosed.) He started taking Adderall @ 10mg 1x per day in the AM, 5 months ago. He is ADHD with all the hyperactivity and lack of ability to focus on any tasks, no matter how minor they may be. He was diagnosed at age 6 in the first grade. We have tried at least 8 different medications in the last four years. As he grows, the meds seem to sometime lose their effect after a certain period of time. Concerta was great for almost 2yrs and then we tried various others till we found Adderall. It worked GREAT! He stays focused and we do not have any side effects at all! Not even the loss of appetite which was always a problem with the other medications. I am very pleased with this medication, and at times this may be frustrating as a parent to go through finding what works for your child. But once you find the medication that works for your child, it definitely is worth everything to see your child succeed at all he does, especially in school. My son is a very caring, loving and happy child and have never had any problems as far as anger issues that many people might mention. He is just full of energy and cannot stay focused on one task, school assignments or just doing things in order such as fix your bed and next clean out your back pack....he may start the bed but will soon be jumping in the living room having not completed his bed or much less totally forgot about his back pack...

column2: hannahbanana912, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When I first started adderall for my ADHD in March, my doctor perscribed 5mg in the morning, and 5 mg in the afternoon, then raised it to 10mg in the morning and 15 in the afternoon. For the week after it was raised I was EXTREMELY aggitated with everything. But my body eventually got used to the new dosage. Now I'm taking 20mg 2x a day. I'm very happy with how it is working. I can finally concentrate in my classes and at work. Side Effects: weight loss (40 pounds since March, but I was overweight), loss of appetite (which gives me a headache, so I have to remind myself to eat), loss of thrist, nausea (at least 2-3x a week, between 2-5 hours), headache, aggitation (only slightly), trouble breathing (rarely, it feels like I'm not breathing in enough air, but my dr gave me an allergy med that helps most the time). I have a lot of side effects, but honestly, the fact that I can concentrate and get stuff done outweighs them.

column2: dukecitydude, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Adderall is one of the very few true "miracle drugs." I was finally diagnosed with ADHD (primarily inattentive) at age 23. I've been prescribed the other meds, but for the past 10 years I've been on the same dose of Adderall (20mg t.i.d.) and nothing works better. With Adderall I am able to focus, think before acting, I'm much less anxious and my temper is curbed. All of which give me much more confidence in the things I do. Hell, it even helps me sleep better!Prior to diagnosis w/ADHD, I had a brief stint of drug use (and I know that's a contraindication), but in all honesty, Adderall was of great help in stopping those behaviours. It's amazing what can happen when a person gains cognitive clarity & patience to assist in positive decision-making.Although it can increase anxiety in some and if you have cardiovascular issues - forget it, I highly recommend at least a trial of this medication if you have ADD/ADHD. It continues to do wonders for me. :)

column2: Raeleigh, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed adderall 15mg once daily at first for ADHD. I would take it at about 8AM and by lunch time it was worn off and I just crashed. My doctor then prescribed me 20MG XR once daily. This has worked so much better for me and seems to last about 7-8 hours. Side effects when taking 15MG immediate release tabs: SEVERE dry-mouth, loss of appetite, headaches, upset stomach, mood swings. Side effects from 20MG XR tabs: Extreme weight loss (24 lbs.) over a 2 month period, Loss of appetite, constipation. No more dry mouth,  headaches or mood swings. This has turned out to be a wonderful drug for me. I can complete tasks at my job and actually focus and pay attention now.

column2: huggybearbarry, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Years ago, I had a TIA & it gave me such a "wild" sensation (whole left side went numb) that I shall never forget it. Years after that, I had a tingling sensation that was so similar to my earlier TIA, that I thought it was an aura signaling another onset of a TIA or worse yet, a full blown stroke. So I made a "beeline" to the ER & the ER Dr.'s had no idea what it was. So, they got on the phone with what I'm calling a "lifesaver" as he (Dr. Alan S. Zacharias, a "guru" of a neurologist here in Boulder, CO), knew, once they told him all the Rx's I was taking, e.g., Adderal, what was going on, i.e., that the Adderall was the problem, told the ER Dr.'s that info & had them tell me to stop taking the Rx Adderall immediately. I did & the tinglings went away forever. That is ONE STRONG Rx!!! Now, I'm taking generic Ritalin & no side effects, i.e., tinglings. So, now on to this wonderful WEBMD website. It's here where I found that those who've had a stroke, or in my case, a TIA, should NOT be taking Adderal -- therefore, thank you for being so inclusive, exhaustive, comprehensive, etc unlike the PDR where no mention was made of that contraindication. Thanks, Barry

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was first prescribed Adderall XR when I was 16 years old. But in addition to that diagnoses of ADHD I was also told I had Bipolar Disorder. Now that I am in my 20s I have a worry about the long term side effects. Every doctor I have asked assures me that there are no proven negative long term effects of taking this medication for a long period of time.  But I can help but think otherwise. It is an amphetamine after all. Other issues I am concerned about have been the effect it has on me when I stop taking it completely. I am very tired and don't really know what to expect or I'm aware of things that are going on around me but can't really grasp the concepts. I have tried the none Extended Release Adderall and it was very unsatisfactory! BLEH! I would take one in the morning and then one in the afternoon and I had major side effects, tremors, ticks, I kept clenching my jaw and I was very unhappy. I am satisfied with the results and ease of the XR tablets. But I still think about the long term side effects...kind of feel like a lab rat considering every doctor I've asked about them seems to think that I'll be fine...I guess I'll find out, eventually...

McBlack, 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My little sister was prescribed Adderall when she was about 10. She has ADHD. The stereotypical kind: jumping off the walls, impulsive behavior, low grades, unable to focus on a conversation for more than a minute, etc. Anyway, shortly after she began taking it, she became like a zombie. Sure, the "desired" effect was achieved; she was calm, followed directions easily, blah. BUT AT WHAT RISK TO HER BODY & MIND?! She walked around the house in a daze. She was incessantly licking her now-dry lips. She never, EVER had an appetite. And what really made me object was watching her tick. She would involuntarily buck her eyes and tongue. When I say buck, I mean REALLY HARD. Like POP. normal. POP. And so on. I hated seeing my sister twitch and could only wince at the thought of the long-term damaging effects this PRESCRIBED (meth)AMPHETAMINE (or whtvr the flying feck) was having on her actual brain. I just found out I have ADHD. And I will fight to the death, refusing to take these meds. There's another way.
